s.text: Some examples, taken from the delightful Samuel Johnson Sound Bite Page maintained by Frank Lynch.

"Because of an ancient Scottish curse, anyone who writes a life of these four historical personages ends up reproducing, word for word and comma for comma, a long-out-of-print biography that they have never even read!"
Things which grow wild here, must be cultivated with great care in Scotland.

While Mackay acknowledges similarities between his books and those from which he is accused of copying, he denies wrongdoing, pointing out that "there are only a certain number of words in the English language."
